com.example.noteation.fragments

Class TasksFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
      • com.example.noteation.fragments.TasksFragment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, androidx.activity.result.ActivityResultCaller, androidx.lifecycle.HasDefaultViewModelProviderFactory, androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelStoreOwner, androidx.savedstate.SavedStateRegistryOwner

    public class TasksFragment
extends androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
    This class is in charge of showing the tasks in a list and allowing the user to create a new task, either a "time task" or a "location task"

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class androidx.fragment.app.Fragment

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void getTasks(int requestCode, int taskId)
      Shows, adds, updates, deletes or completes tasks in the recyclerView depending on the "requestCode" param
      private void initCheckBoxes(android.view.View view)
      Initiates all of the checkboxes and sets an "onCheckedChangesListeners" to all of them in order to check which option the user checked (what colors and ratings he filtered)
      private void initSpinner(android.view.View view)
      Initiates the spinner and sets an "onItemSelectedListener" to check which option the user picked
      static TasksFragment newInstance() 
      android.view.View onCreateView(android.view.LayoutInflater inflater, android.view.ViewGroup container, android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)

      private void setImageFilter(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> colors, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> ratings, int spinnerOption)
      Changes the "imageFilterTasks" icon to the filter icon if the user has activated any filters, if the user didn't activate any filters, it sets the icon to the off filter icon
      private void showFilterTasksDialog()
      Shows a dialog to allow the user to sort the tasks by color and importance.
      protected void showTaskTypeDialog()
      Shows a dialog to see which type of task the user wants to create, either a time task or a location task (the user picks which task by selecting an option from the radio group)

      • showTaskTypeDialog

        protected void showTaskTypeDialog()
        Shows a dialog to see which type of task the user wants to create, either a time task or a location task (the user picks which task by selecting an option from the radio group)

      • onTaskClicked

        public void onTaskClicked(Task task,
                          int position,
                          boolean isTaskTime)
        When a task is clicked, it sends the user to view the task
        Parameters:
        task - The clicked task
        position - The position of the task in the RecyclerView
        isTaskTime - The type of task (time task or location task)

      • getTasks

        public void getTasks(int requestCode,
                     int taskId)
        Shows, adds, updates, deletes or completes tasks in the recyclerView depending on the "requestCode" param
        Parameters:
        requestCode - The type of action for the RecyclerView (showing, adding, updating, deleting, completing)
        taskId - The id of the task

      • showFilterTasksDialog

        private void showFilterTasksDialog()
        Shows a dialog to allow the user to sort the tasks by color and importance. It's also in charge of all the "onCheckedListeners" of the checkboxes and the "OnSelectListener" of the spinner

      • initSpinner

        private void initSpinner(android.view.View view)
        Initiates the spinner and sets an "onItemSelectedListener" to check which option the user picked
        Parameters:
        view - The dialog's view

      • initCheckBoxes

        private void initCheckBoxes(android.view.View view)
        Initiates all of the checkboxes and sets an "onCheckedChangesListeners" to all of them in order to check which option the user checked (what colors and ratings he filtered)
        Parameters:
        view - The dialog's view

      • setImageFilter

        private void setImageFilter(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> colors,
                            java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> ratings,
                            int spinnerOption)
        Changes the "imageFilterTasks" icon to the filter icon if the user has activated any filters, if the user didn't activate any filters, it sets the icon to the off filter icon
        Parameters:
        colors - The array of colors filtered by the user
        ratings - The array of ratings filtered by the user
        spinnerOption - The spinner option selected by the user
